definition[0]: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something as a way of protesting
example[0]: We boycott all products tested on animals.
definition[1]: an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted
example[1]: They are now trying to organize a boycott.
example[3]: He called for a boycott of the elections.
definition[2]: to refuse to buy something, use something, or take part in something, as a way of protesting
example[4]: In the past, Mandela had called for people to boycott South African goods.
example[5]: Palestinian leaders threatened to boycott the talks.
definition[3]: when people boycott something, or the period of time when it is boycotted
example[6]: In 1937 the cocoa farmers imposed a boycott on European imports.
example[7]: He called for an end to the Arab economic boycott of Israel.
